definition: to invade/(of a storm etc) to strike/to hit
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next
to attack/to inherit/classifier for suits (esp. of funeral robes)

sentences.english: Saab’s ARTHUR radar system locates incoming enemy projectiles and missiles.
sentences.chinese: ARTHUR雷達系統可定位敵方來襲炮彈和導彈。

sentences.english: I was at home when the typhoon hit.
sentences.chinese: 颱風來襲的時候，我正待在家裏。

sentences.english: See it, when The Empire Strikes Back.
sentences.chinese: 當《帝國反擊戰》來襲時，去看吧。

sentences.english: There were several alarms during the night but no actual air raid took place.
sentences.chinese: 當夜，空襲警報拉響了數次，但並沒有飛機來襲。

sentences.english: Buy the right car now, and you'll have no trouble outrunning the zombie apocalypse when it comes.
sentences.chinese: 趁現在買輛好車，好在殭屍來襲時衝出重圍。

sentences.english: Two hundred years ago, Germany suffered suddenly hit the vineyards of ShuangHai.
sentences.chinese: 兩百年前的德國，葡萄園遭受到突然來襲的霜害。

sentences.english: When a storm struck, the Russians would stop fishing, because it was too dangerous.
sentences.chinese: 當風暴來襲時，俄羅斯人將停止捕撈，因爲太危險了。

sentences.english: He leaves his friends behind and skips away alone when the shark comes to assault them.
sentences.chinese: 他在沙魚來襲時拋棄了同伴，讀自溜走了。

sentences.english: Shatter: All the glass and some of the building shattered when the earthquake hit the city.
sentences.chinese: 地震來襲的時候，所有的玻璃和一些房屋都震碎了。

sentences.english: Some people are so dehydrated, that they confuse it for hunger pains.
sentences.chinese: 一些人把脫水誤認爲是飢餓來襲。

sentences.english: Have you begun preparing for a zombie apocalypse?
sentences.chinese: 你已經開始爲殭屍來襲做準備了嗎？

sentences.english: It's good to know the 8700r sports Bluetooth and integrated speakerphone for handsfree operation.
sentences.chinese: 它的好，知道來襲體育藍牙和集成揚聲器爲免提操作。

sentences.english: At least seven people were killed as Nesat lashed the Philippines, authorities said, bringing waist-deep floods, blackouts and dramatic storm surges.
sentences.chinese: 菲律賓當局稱，“納沙”來襲，至少造成7人死亡。

sentences.english: It will coincide two days later with a very high tide.
sentences.chinese: 洪水來襲兩天之後，恰巧又是在一次非常大的高潮期。

sentences.english: Since the crisis hit, her monthly salary has been cut in half.
sentences.chinese: 經濟危機來襲後，她的月薪已被削減了一半。

sentences.english: A new fashion trend, surgical masks worn in public, the SARS spreads to the US.
sentences.chinese: 非典來襲，戴口罩成爲新時尚。

definition: storm/violent commotion/fig. crisis (e.g. revolution, uprising, financial crisis etc)
variant of 動蕩|动荡[dong4 dang4]
tempest/wave (of popular sentiment etc)/craze or fad
currently popular (of movie stars, singers etc)
lit. foul wind and bloody rain (idiom)/fig. reign of terror/carnage
copious/plentiful (of water)/surging (of waves)/refers to home village of first Han emperor 漢高祖|汉高祖[Han4 Gao1 zu3]/fig. majestic
